pullRequest.body:
Porting the first part of [mathlib3 #16157](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/16157).

This contains the `NoZeroDivisor` instance on `AddMonoidAlgebra`s that will trickle down to `(Mv)Polynomial`s.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
-->
- [ ] depends on: #20944

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20944~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Thanks to everyone for reducing the diff and isolating lemmas to rescue.

With the much cleaner diff that the PR has with master now, I do not think that there is much else that I feel the need to salvage.

If everyone agrees, I am happy to close this PR.
I am closing this PR, since its interesting content has already been merged and what is left is an alternative, clunkier proof of something that is already in mathlib.

Currently, [`Covariants.to_uniqueSums`](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/ae74c2e545c4f18cea002d8c25b12b0ed38d2fcf/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/UniqueProds.lean#L213-L214) uses the stronger set of conditions
```
 [CovariantClass A A (Â· * Â·) (Â· â‰¤ Â·)] [CovariantClass A A (Function.swap (Â· * Â·)) (Â· < Â·)]
 [ContravariantClass A A (Â· * Â·) (Â· â‰¤ Â·)]
```
In fact the last condition is equivalent to `[CovariantClass A A (Â· + Â·) (Â· < Â·)]` in a linear order because `a + c â‰¤ a + b â†’ c â‰¤ b` is simply the contrapositive of `b < c â†’ a + b < a + c`.

I think the way to go is to change `Covariants.to_uniqueSums` (and `eq_and_eq_of_le_of_le_of_add_le`) to use the same conditions as here, prove `NoZeroDivisors.uniqueSums` here instead, and derive `NoZeroDivisors.biOrdered` from it. And I think we can make the proof of `NoZeroDivisors.of_left_ordered` etc. a single line.

Maybe we could make `UniqueSums` a typeclass and then `NoZeroDivisors.biOrdered` would be `inferInstance`.

Also, it should be trivial to add the `MonoidAlgebra` version, but I think `to_additive` doesn't work here.
Yes, you are right: the plan was indeed to use `UniqueSums`!  I simply got stuck a few PRs before the port started...  I'll fix it, but now is time to sleep for me!

Thanks and no worries! It's my bad that I already realized the PR is outdated  but still mentioned it. No rush to update PR because I find that stuff around `Covariant`/`ContravariantClass`es should benefit from some refactoring utilizing Lean 4's loopy instances: there are lots of results of the shape A â†” B, or A â†’ B and B âˆ§ C â†’ A. It would be nice to unify the assumptions of [Left.add_eq_add_iff_eq_and_eq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Monoid/Lemmas.html#Left.add_eq_add_iff_eq_and_eq), Right.add_eq_add_iff_eq_and_eq, and your [eq_and_eq_of_le_of_le_of_add_le](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Monoid/Basic.html#eq_and_eq_of_le_of_le_of_add_le), for example. I'll keep you updated!

(And I just realized UniqueProds and UniqueSums are indeed already instances; I confused them with UniqueMul and UniqueMul.

```suggestion
mul_apply_of_le (A := Aáµ’áµˆ) fa gb
```
and elsewhere
Good point, thanks!

```suggestion
assumptions actually imply that `A` is cancellative.  However, cancellativity alone is not enough.
```
Does this belong in `Counterexamples/`?

```suggestion
    (AddMonoidAlgebra.single a r * f) (a + t) = r * f t := by
```

```suggestion
    (AddMonoidAlgebra.single a r * f) (a + b) = r * f b :=
  single_mul_apply_of_le (A := Aáµ’áµˆ) _ fb
```

```suggestion
    (f * g) (a + t) = f a * g t := by
```

```suggestion
    (f * g) (a + b) = f a * g b :=
  mul_apply_of_le (A := Aáµ’áµˆ) fa gb
```

```suggestion
    (f * g) (a + b) = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
  refine mul_ne_zero ?_ ?_ <;>
```

I think this main result of this PR is now covered by [TwoUniqueSums.of_covariant_left](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/UniqueProds/Basic.html#TwoUniqueSums.of_covariant_left), [TwoUniqueSums.toUniqueSums](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/UniqueProds/Basic.html#TwoUniqueSums.toUniqueSums), and [AddMonoidAlgebra.instNoZeroDivisorsOfUniqueSums](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/MonoidAlgebra/NoZeroDivisors.html#AddMonoidAlgebra.instNoZeroDivisorsOfUniqueSums). (AddLeftStrictMono implies IsLeftCancelAdd)

> AddLeftStrictMono implies IsLeftCancelAdd

Does it? I don't think mathlib knows this.

Also requires linearity:
```
import Mathlib

variable {Î± : Type*} [LinearOrder Î±] [Add Î±] [AddLeftStrictMono Î±]

instance : IsLeftCancelAdd Î± where
  add_left_cancel _ b c h := by
    contrapose! h
    obtain lt|lt := h.lt_or_lt
    exacts [(add_lt_add_left lt _).ne, (add_lt_add_left lt _).ne']
```
That's probably a bad instance, but maybe worth having as a theorem

@YaelDillies, the goal here is
```lean
instâœÂ² : Add A
instâœÂ¹ : PartialOrder A
instâœ : AddLeftStrictMono A
a t t' : A
ft : t' â‰¤ t
âŠ¢ a + t' = a + t â†” t' = t
```
should this be a lemma somewhere?
Oh yes, that looks like a good lemma to have. You could name it `add_right_inj_of_le`
@adomani, perhaps this entire PR can be dropped and actually this MonoidAlgebra-free lemma (and the one that @alreadydone suggests above) are all we actually need?

This looks like a good idea: writing the (lean3 version of this) PR, I decided that it was better to use `UniqueSums` instead, but then I had forgotten about `UniqueSums` and ported this PR.

I am happy that something can be salvaged from it, though!
#20973 contains the lemmas from here.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/MonoidAlgebra/NoZeroDivisors): `NoZeroDivisors` instance on `AddMonoidAlgebra`s

With the much cleaner diff that the PR has with master now, I do not think that there is much else that I feel the need to salvage.

If everyone agrees, I am happy to close this PR.
